alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Burlington; Cape May; Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 1:46PM EDT until June 16 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT FOR ATLANTIC...OCEAN...NORTHEASTERN CAPE MAY...SOUTHEASTERN BURLINGTON AND SOUTHEASTERN MONMOUTH COUNTIES... At 145 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Collingwood Park to Seaside Heights to near Beach Haven West to near Somers Point, moving east at 40 mph. This line of storms has a history of producing a 61 mph wind gust at Joint Base MDL. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Atlantic City, Long Branch, Asbury Park, Ocean City, Lakewood, Jackson, Howell, Barnegat, Pleasantville, Tinton Falls, Beachwood, Somers Point, Ventnor City, Brigantine, Northfield, Absecon, Margate City, Manasquan and Point Pleasant Beach. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 21 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 20 and 109. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 0 and 20. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm, and the storm will affect the beaches. For your safety, immediately move off the beach and seek shelter indoors.

area.areaDesc: Atlantic; Burlington; Cape May; Monmouth; Ocean
